intro: Piqueria eupatorium, commonly known as Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its showy yellow to orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Piqueria eupatorium is also known for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
